welcomeMessage: Hi **@chauler**, how can I help you?

response.value:
Snippet with error: ```html

Exercise Videos

``` Location of error: In the section containing the "Exercise Videos" heading and the iframe for the video. WCAG Guideline violated: 2.1.1 Keyboard (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for event handlers that may not be accessible via keyboard. Explanation of Error: The `onmouseout` event handler on the h2 element is not keyboard accessible. This means that users who rely on keyboard navigation will not be able to trigger this event, which could lead to a different user experience for them. --- Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: In the iframe for the video. WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for elements that require a description or title. Explanation of Error: The iframe does not have a title attribute. This attribute is important for screen readers, as it provides a description of the content of the iframe. --- Snippet with error: ```html



``` Location of error: In the form for contacting. WCAG Guideline violated: 1.3.1 Info and Relationships (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for form elements without labels or with duplicate labels. Explanation of Error: The input field for name does not have a corresponding label, which is necessary for screen readers to properly identify the purpose of the input field. Also, there are two labels for the email input field, which can be confusing for screen reader users. The submit button lacks descriptive text, making it unclear for screen reader users what action the button performs.

followups.message: What are some best practices for making forms accessible in HTML?

b.description: Ask Copilot or type / for commands

metadata.helpTextPrefix: You can ask me general programming questions, or chat with the following participants which have specialized expertise and can perform actions:
metadata.helpTextVariablesPrefix: You can also help me understand your question by using the following variables to give me extra context:

helpTextPostfix.value:
To have a great conversation, ask me questions as if I was a real programmer:

* **Show me the code** you want to talk about by having the files open and selecting the most important lines.
* **Make refinements** by asking me follow-up questions, adding clarifications, providing errors, etc.
* **Review my suggested code** and tell me about issues or improvements, so I can iterate on it.

You can also ask me questions about your editor selection by [starting an inline chat session](command:inlineChat.start).

Learn more about [GitHub Copilot](https://docs.github.com/copilot/using-github-copilot/getting-started-with-github-copilot?tool=vscode&utm_source=editor&utm_medium=chat-panel&utm_campaign=2024q3-em-MSFT-getstarted) in [Visual Studio Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/copilot/overview).

b.name: GitHub Copilot

parts.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

message.text: Are there any more issues? List all that you find.

response.value:
Snippet with error: ```html Home Workouts Nutrition Contact ``` Location of error: In the navigation menu. WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.4 Link Purpose (In Context) (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for links with generic text or placeholders. Explanation of Error: The links in the navigation menu all have a href attribute of "#", which doesn't provide any context about the destination of the link. This can be confusing for screen reader users who rely on the href attribute to understand where the link will take them. --- Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: In the section containing the welcome message. WCAG Guideline violated: 1.1.1 Non-text Content (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for images with generic alt text. Explanation of Error: The alt text for the image is "Fitness Image", which doesn't provide a clear description of the image content. Alt text should be descriptive and provide context for those who cannot see the image. --- Snippet with error: ```html ``` Location of error: In the contact form. WCAG Guideline violated: 4.1.2 Name, Role, Value (Level A) Detection Algorithm: Checking for interactive elements without text or labels. Explanation of Error: The submit button lacks any text or aria-label attribute, making it unclear for screen reader users what action the button performs. --- Snippet with error: ```html

Fitness Tracker

``` Location of error: In the header of the page. WCAG Guideline violated: 2.4.6 Headings and Labels (Level AA) Detection Algorithm: Checking for headings that are not descriptive. Explanation of Error: The heading "Fitness Tracker" is not descriptive enough. It should provide more context about the content of the page or section it is heading. For example, "Welcome to Fitness Tracker - Your Personal Workout and Nutrition Guide" would be more descriptive.

followups.message: What are some best practices for improving the accessibility of HTML forms?
